curricula.abstract: Explore this curriculum on Automatic Text Recognition (ATR) and learn how to efficiently extract full text from heritage material images. Perfectly tailored for researchers, librarians, and archivists, these resources not only enhance your archival research and preservation efforts but also unlock the potential for computational analysis of your sources.

curricula.title: Git: A Concise Introduction

tags.name: Data management
tags.description: Data Management is a set of practices and techniques used by researchers to ensure that their data is organised, structured and easily reusable for future research

tags.name: Git
tags.description: Git is a distributed version control system that tracks different versions of files and folders of a project, mainly used for collaboration.

resources.title: Git Version Control via Command Line

tags.name: Data management
tags.description: Data Management is a set of practices and techniques used by researchers to ensure that their data is organised, structured and easily reusable for future research

tags.name: Git
tags.description: Git is a distributed version control system that tracks different versions of files and folders of a project, mainly used for collaboration.

categories.name: ACDH-CH
categories.description: The Austrian Centre for Digital Humanities and Cultural Heritage (ACDH-CH) conducts research in the humanities using digital tools and methods and is engaged in building and maintaining DH-related infrastructures.

resources.abstract: This article introduces the main concepts in Git and basic Git commands that can be used from the command line. Understanding these commands will help you with using Git in a code editor, the Git desktop and other options, like GitHub online.

resources.title: Git Collaboration

tags.name: Data management
tags.description: Data Management is a set of practices and techniques used by researchers to ensure that their data is organised, structured and easily reusable for future research

tags.name: Git
tags.description: Git is a distributed version control system that tracks different versions of files and folders of a project, mainly used for collaboration.

categories.name: ACDH-CH
categories.description: The Austrian Centre for Digital Humanities and Cultural Heritage (ACDH-CH) conducts research in the humanities using digital tools and methods and is engaged in building and maintaining DH-related infrastructures.

resources.abstract: This short course will help learners understand how to work with Git in a collaborative setting such as teamwork or group projects, and how to make use of platforms like GitHub or GitLab to complete that work.

resources.title: Git: VS Code

tags.name: Data management
tags.description: Data Management is a set of practices and techniques used by researchers to ensure that their data is organised, structured and easily reusable for future research

tags.name: Git
tags.description: Git is a distributed version control system that tracks different versions of files and folders of a project, mainly used for collaboration.

categories.name: ACDH-CH
categories.description: The Austrian Centre for Digital Humanities and Cultural Heritage (ACDH-CH) conducts research in the humanities using digital tools and methods and is engaged in building and maintaining DH-related infrastructures.

resources.abstract: Getting access to the data on GitLab is different on all three operating systems. This post shows how to use the code editor VS Code with its graphical user interface for working collaboratively in Git with Windows, Mac and Linux.

curricula.abstract: This curriculum introduces main concepts of Git. It offers a step-by-step tutorial for beginners to get started with Git, a free and open-source version control system.

curricula.title: Datenmanagement

tags.name: Data management
tags.description: Data Management is a set of practices and techniques used by researchers to ensure that their data is organised, structured and easily reusable for future research

resources.title: Grundlagen des Datenmanagements

tags.name: Data management
tags.description: Data Management is a set of practices and techniques used by researchers to ensure that their data is organised, structured and easily reusable for future research

categories.name: ACDH-CH
categories.description: The Austrian Centre for Digital Humanities and Cultural Heritage (ACDH-CH) conducts research in the humanities using digital tools and methods and is engaged in building and maintaining DH-related infrastructures.

resources.abstract: Dieses Kapitel erläutert einige grundlegende Regeln für ein aktives und gutes Datenmanagement und beschreibt, wie Dateien und Ordner sinnvoll und eindeutig benannt und strukturiert werden können, wie man mit Versionierung arbeitet und welche Dateiformate für die Nachnutzbarkeit und Langzeitarchivierung geeignet sind.

resources.title: Einführung in Metadaten und Dokumentation

tags.name: Data management
tags.description: Data Management is a set of practices and techniques used by researchers to ensure that their data is organised, structured and easily reusable for future research

categories.name: ACDH-CH
categories.description: The Austrian Centre for Digital Humanities and Cultural Heritage (ACDH-CH) conducts research in the humanities using digital tools and methods and is engaged in building and maintaining DH-related infrastructures.

resources.abstract: Anschließend an die "Grundlagen des Datenmanagements" und der praktischen Übung zu Datenmanagement bietet dieser Kurs eine Einführung in das Thema Metadaten. Was sind Metadaten? Aus welchen Komponenten bestehen sie? Und welche Typen von Metadaten können wir unterscheiden?

resources.title: Langzeitarchivierung

tags.name: Data management
tags.description: Data Management is a set of practices and techniques used by researchers to ensure that their data is organised, structured and easily reusable for future research

categories.name: ACDH-CH
categories.description: The Austrian Centre for Digital Humanities and Cultural Heritage (ACDH-CH) conducts research in the humanities using digital tools and methods and is engaged in building and maintaining DH-related infrastructures.

resources.abstract: Dieser Kurs gibt einen Einblick in die langfristige Bewahrung digitaler Daten, d.h. die Archivierung digitaler Daten. Es werden praktische Tipps aus der Perspektive der Datenersteller gegeben.

curricula.abstract: In diesem  Curriculum wird die Erhaltung des Lebenszyklus von geisteswissenschaftlichen (Forschungs-)Daten thematisiert. Schwerpunkte sind Datenmanagement, Metadaten und Langzeitarchivierung.

curricula.title: The ELEXIS Curriculum

tags.name: Lexicography
tags.description: Lexicography is the art and craft of making dictionaries

resources.title: Introduction to Dictionaries

tags.name: Lexicography
tags.description: Lexicography is the art and craft of making dictionaries

categories.name: DARIAH
categories.description: DARIAH is a pan-European infrastructure for arts and humanities scholars working with computational methods. It supports digital research as well as the teaching of digital research methods.

resources.abstract: The goal of this course is to introduce a brief history of dictionaries as tools for the organization of knowledge about words and their meanings, and to analyze different ways of understanding and classifying the dictionary genre.

resources.title: Introduction to Dictionary Users

tags.name: Lexicography
tags.description: Lexicography is the art and craft of making dictionaries

resources.abstract: The goal of this course is to introduce students to the important role played by dictionary usage research when developing and implementing new dictionaries.

categories.name: DARIAH
categories.description: DARIAH is a pan-European infrastructure for arts and humanities scholars working with computational methods. It supports digital research as well as the teaching of digital research methods.

resources.title: Introduction to Corpus-Based Lexicographic Practice

tags.name: Lexicography
tags.description: Lexicography is the art and craft of making dictionaries

categories.name: DARIAH
categories.description: DARIAH is a pan-European infrastructure for arts and humanities scholars working with computational methods. It supports digital research as well as the teaching of digital research methods.

resources.abstract: This course will explore the notion of lexicographic evidence and the limitation of subjective views on language by tracing the changes in lexicographic practice from the extensive use of manually selected citations to the employment of large language corpora.

resources.title: Capturing, Modeling and Transforming Lexical Data: An Introduction

tags.name: Lexicography
tags.description: Lexicography is the art and craft of making dictionaries

categories.name: DARIAH
categories.description: DARIAH is a pan-European infrastructure for arts and humanities scholars working with computational methods. It supports digital research as well as the teaching of digital research methods.

resources.abstract: This course will introduce the theories, practices, and methods of digitizing legacy dictionaries for research, preservation and online distribution by focusing on the process of converting paper-based dictionaries to electronic format through image capture, text capture, data modeling and data enrichment.

resources.title: LEX2: Mastering ELEXIS Corpus Tools for Lexicographic Purposes

tags.name: Lexicography
tags.description: Lexicography is the art and craft of making dictionaries

categories.name: DARIAH
categories.description: DARIAH is a pan-European infrastructure for arts and humanities scholars working with computational methods. It supports digital research as well as the teaching of digital research methods.

resources.abstract: The course will introduce corpus tools available in ELEXIS and describe various ways in which they can be exploited in lexicographic research and for compiling dictionaries.

resources.title: Lexonomy: Mastering the ELEXIS Dictionary Writing System

tags.name: Lexicography
tags.description: Lexicography is the art and craft of making dictionaries

categories.name: DARIAH
categories.description: DARIAH is a pan-European infrastructure for arts and humanities scholars working with computational methods. It supports digital research as well as the teaching of digital research methods.

resources.abstract: The course will explore how software tools for dictionary production (so-called dictionary writing systems, or DWS) can be used to streamline and facilitate the structural coherence and quality assurance in a dictionary project by focusing on Lexonomy, a dictionary-writing system developed as part of ELEXIS.

resources.title: Automating the Process of Dictionary Creation

tags.name: Lexicography
tags.description: Lexicography is the art and craft of making dictionaries

categories.name: DARIAH
categories.description: DARIAH is a pan-European infrastructure for arts and humanities scholars working with computational methods. It supports digital research as well as the teaching of digital research methods.

resources.abstract: Building upon the material covered in LEX2: Mastering ELEXIS Corpus Tools for Lexicographic Purposes and Lexonomy: Mastering the ELEXIS Dictionary Writing System, this course will focus specifically on the changes in dictionary production after 2000 and the increasing importance of automation and post-editing in lexicography.

resources.title: CLARIN Tools and Resources for Lexicographic Work

authors.description: Matej Ďurčo is Chief Technology Officer for DARIAH-EU. He is also head of the technical group "Digital Humanities Research & Infrastructure" at the Austrian Centre for Digital Humanities and Cultural Heritage at the Austrian Academy of Sciences and one of the key figures in founding this institute. Since 2009, he has also participated actively in the Austrian research infrastructures core group and supported the build-up of the pan-European research infrastructures CLARIN and DARIAH, both on the Austrian and European levels. Besides building technical infrastructures, his main concern has been the social aspect, sharing knowledge and acting as interpreter between humanities research and the technical world ensuring mutual understanding in order to find optimal solutions for the specific needs of the researchers.

tags.name: Lexicography
tags.description: Lexicography is the art and craft of making dictionaries

resources.abstract: This course will present an overview of resources available from CLARIN that may be useful for the lexicographer; we refer to  lexical datasets but also to textual resources such as corpora, as well as tools.

categories.name: DARIAH
categories.description: DARIAH is a pan-European infrastructure for arts and humanities scholars working with computational methods. It supports digital research as well as the teaching of digital research methods.

resources.title: Standards for Representing Lexicographic Data: An Overview

tags.name: Lexicography
tags.description: Lexicography is the art and craft of making dictionaries

categories.name: DARIAH
categories.description: DARIAH is a pan-European infrastructure for arts and humanities scholars working with computational methods. It supports digital research as well as the teaching of digital research methods.

resources.abstract: This course focuses on the importance of standards to facilitate the cooperation among lexicographers in a multilingual and multicultural context.

resources.title: Modeling Dictionaries in TEI Lex-0

tags.name: Lexicography
tags.description: Lexicography is the art and craft of making dictionaries

categories.name: DARIAH
categories.description: DARIAH is a pan-European infrastructure for arts and humanities scholars working with computational methods. It supports digital research as well as the teaching of digital research methods.

resources.abstract: The course will focus on modeling dictionaries using TEI Lex-0, a subset of the community standard TEI (Text Encoding Initiative).

resources.title: Modeling Dictionaries in OntoLex-Lemon

tags.name: Lexicography
tags.description: Lexicography is the art and craft of making dictionaries

categories.name: DARIAH
categories.description: DARIAH is a pan-European infrastructure for arts and humanities scholars working with computational methods. It supports digital research as well as the teaching of digital research methods.

resources.abstract: This course describes the OntoLex-Lemon model, a recent standard for the representation of lexical information on the Web as linked data.

resources.title: LEX3: Transforming Legacy Dictionaries using Elexifier

tags.name: Lexicography
tags.description: Lexicography is the art and craft of making dictionaries

categories.name: DARIAH
categories.description: DARIAH is a pan-European infrastructure for arts and humanities scholars working with computational methods. It supports digital research as well as the teaching of digital research methods.

resources.abstract: This course introduces Elexifier, a cloud-based dictionary service for the conversion of legacy XML and PDF dictionaries into a shared data format based on the ELEXIS Data Model.

resources.title: LEX3: Publishing Legacy Dictionaries with Publex

tags.name: Lexicography
tags.description: Lexicography is the art and craft of making dictionaries

resources.abstract: This course introduces Publex, a modern, generic, modular dictionary publication tool for retrodigitized / legacy dictionaries.

categories.name: DARIAH
categories.description: DARIAH is a pan-European infrastructure for arts and humanities scholars working with computational methods. It supports digital research as well as the teaching of digital research methods.

resources.title: Lexicography in the Age of Open Data

tags.name: Lexicography
tags.description: Lexicography is the art and craft of making dictionaries

categories.name: DARIAH
categories.description: DARIAH is a pan-European infrastructure for arts and humanities scholars working with computational methods. It supports digital research as well as the teaching of digital research methods.

resources.abstract: This course explores the principles of open access, open data, FAIR principles and open science as they apply to lexicography including the specific challenges posed by intellectual property rights and copyright issues in the context of lexicographic work.

resources.title: Mastering LEX1: The Dictionary Matrix

tags.name: Lexicography
tags.description: Lexicography is the art and craft of making dictionaries

resources.abstract: This course will introduce the concept and the ELEXIS implementation of the dictionary matrix, a universal repository of linked senses, and other types of lexical information found in existing lexicographic resources.

categories.name: DARIAH
categories.description: DARIAH is a pan-European infrastructure for arts and humanities scholars working with computational methods. It supports digital research as well as the teaching of digital research methods.

resources.title: Mastering oXygen XML Editor for Dictionary Nerds

tags.name: Lexicography
tags.description: Lexicography is the art and craft of making dictionaries

categories.name: DARIAH
categories.description: DARIAH is a pan-European infrastructure for arts and humanities scholars working with computational methods. It supports digital research as well as the teaching of digital research methods.

resources.abstract: This course will help users learn how to use oXygen XML, a versatile, professional-grade XML editor to edit, validate, query and transform lexicographic data.

resources.title: Extracting Lexical Data: XPath for Dictionary Nerds

tags.name: Lexicography
tags.description: Lexicography is the art and craft of making dictionaries

tags.name: XPath
tags.description: XPath is a standard query language for selecting nodes from XML documents

tags.name: XML
tags.description: XML (eXtensible Markup Language) is a markup language for storing and transporting data in both human-readable and machine-readable format, making it interoperable across digital platforms

categories.name: DARIAH
categories.description: DARIAH is a pan-European infrastructure for arts and humanities scholars working with computational methods. It supports digital research as well as the teaching of digital research methods.

resources.abstract: XPath (XML Path Language) is a standard query language for selecting nodes from XML documents. In this step-by-step tutorial, you will learn how to write XPath expressions in order to navigate around our XML-encoded dictionaries and select only those bits of data that you are interested in.

resources.title: Transforming Lexical Data: XSLT for Dictionary Nerds

tags.name: Lexicography
tags.description: Lexicography is the art and craft of making dictionaries

categories.name: DARIAH
categories.description: DARIAH is a pan-European infrastructure for arts and humanities scholars working with computational methods. It supports digital research as well as the teaching of digital research methods.

resources.abstract: The course builds upon Extracting Lexical Data: XPath for Dictionary Nerds and introduces the basics of XSL Transformations (XSLT), a standard language for transforming XML documents.

resources.title: ELEXIS Pathfinder to Computational Lexicography for Developers and Computational Linguists

tags.name: Lexicography
tags.description: Lexicography is the art and craft of making dictionaries

categories.name: DARIAH
categories.description: DARIAH is a pan-European infrastructure for arts and humanities scholars working with computational methods. It supports digital research as well as the teaching of digital research methods.

categories.name: DARIAH Pathfinders
categories.description: Useful collections of external learning resources, curated and contextualized by the DARIAH team.

resources.abstract: This learning resource provides software developers and computational linguists with an overview of the typical  computational processing tasks and software tools in the lexicographic workflow. The resource introduces the most widely used custom developed tools for corpus-based lexicography as well as their functionality.

curricula.abstract: The ELEXIS Curriculum is an integrated set of training materials about electronic lexicography developed in the context of the European Lexicographic Infrastructure.

curricula.title: The PARTHENOS Complete Guide to Research Infrastructures

tags.name: Research infrastructures
tags.description: Research Infrastructures are (virtual) meeting points for researchers in a broad disciplinary field to share, collaborate, network, develop and contribute solutions to the research needs of researchers in their community

tags.name: FAIR
tags.description: FAIR principles of data management are Findable, Accessible, Interoperable and Reusable (FAIR).

tags.name: Data management
tags.description: Data Management is a set of practices and techniques used by researchers to ensure that their data is organised, structured and easily reusable for future research

resources.abstract: By the end of this training module, you will be able to: understand the elements of common definitions of research infrastructures; be able to discuss the importance of issues such as sustainability and interoperability; understand how research infrastructure supports methods and communities; and be aware of some common critiques of digital research infrastructures in the Humanities.

categories.name: PARTHENOS
categories.description: Training modules and resources for researchers, educators, managers, and policy makers who want to learn more about research infrastructures and the issues and methods around them.

tags.name: Research infrastructures
tags.description: Research Infrastructures are (virtual) meeting points for researchers in a broad disciplinary field to share, collaborate, network, develop and contribute solutions to the research needs of researchers in their community

resources.title: Introduction to Research Infrastructures

resources.abstract: This module looks at some of the key management issues that arise within research infrastructures.

categories.name: PARTHENOS
categories.description: Training modules and resources for researchers, educators, managers, and policy makers who want to learn more about research infrastructures and the issues and methods around them.

tags.name: Research infrastructures
tags.description: Research Infrastructures are (virtual) meeting points for researchers in a broad disciplinary field to share, collaborate, network, develop and contribute solutions to the research needs of researchers in their community

resources.title: Management Challenges in Research Infrastructures

resources.abstract: This module examines what is meant by collaboration in humanities research and how this model impacts upon the development of digital humanities, and digital humanities research infrastructures.

categories.name: PARTHENOS
categories.description: Training modules and resources for researchers, educators, managers, and policy makers who want to learn more about research infrastructures and the issues and methods around them.

tags.name: Research infrastructures
tags.description: Research Infrastructures are (virtual) meeting points for researchers in a broad disciplinary field to share, collaborate, network, develop and contribute solutions to the research needs of researchers in their community

resources.title: Introduction to Collaborations in Research Infrastructures

curricula.abstract: This collection of modules from the PARTHENOS project comprise the 'PARTHENOS Complete Guide to Research Infrastructures'.  Each module meets the needs of users at different levels: An 'Introduction to Research Infrastructures' for Beginners; 'Management Challenges in Research Infrastructures' for Intermediate level; and 'Introduction to Collaborations in Research Infrastructures' for Advanced levels.
